function_call.name: classify_mitigation
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_mitigations":[{"name":"Promote access to greenspace in urban environments","category":"Greenery","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Encourage and support the conduct of high quality studies in these areas to gather necessary data for meta-analyses.","category":"Encourage high quality research","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Strive for higher diversity in the quality of studies included in meta-analyses to enable sensitivity analysis.","category":"Encourage high quality research","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Encourage the standardization of health outcome measurements and criteria in research studies to enable meta-analyses in these areas.","category":"Encourage high quality research","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Increase sample size, improve study measurement tools.","category":"Encourage high quality research","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Standardize the assessment criteria for observational and interventional studies to ensure consistency in research","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Implement strict hygiene and sanitation measures during the conduct of the studies, including regular disinfection of study environments and proper equipment, and encourage regular testing for contagious diseases among the individuals involved.","category":"Hygiene and sanitation","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Increase access to green spaces in urban and indoor environments, promote the use of parks and green areas for relaxation and health improvement","category":"Greenery","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Integrate greenspaces within research","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Strictly exclude studies with high risk of bias or low quality, use objective criteria for exclusion","category":"Encourage high quality manuscripts to identify and address potential issues. provide clear guidelines and training for data extraction to ensure uniform and accurate recording of study details.","category":"Encourage high quality research","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Conduct sensitivity analyses and explore potential sources of bias, such as unpublished studies or unpublished data, to assess the robustness of the
